AssociateBrowserSettings.name: AssociateBrowserSettings
AssociateBrowserSettings.documentation: Associates a browser settings resource with a web portal.

AssociateDataProtectionSettings.name: AssociateDataProtectionSettings
AssociateDataProtectionSettings.documentation: Associates a data protection settings resource with a web portal.

AssociateIpAccessSettings.name: AssociateIpAccessSettings
AssociateIpAccessSettings.documentation: Associates an IP access settings resource with a web portal.

AssociateNetworkSettings.name: AssociateNetworkSettings
AssociateNetworkSettings.documentation: Associates a network settings resource with a web portal.

AssociateSessionLogger.name: AssociateSessionLogger
AssociateSessionLogger.documentation: Associates a session logger with a portal.

AssociateTrustStore.name: AssociateTrustStore
AssociateTrustStore.documentation: Associates a trust store with a web portal.

AssociateUserAccessLoggingSettings.name: AssociateUserAccessLoggingSettings
AssociateUserAccessLoggingSettings.documentation: Associates a user access logging settings resource with a web portal.

AssociateUserSettings.name: AssociateUserSettings
AssociateUserSettings.documentation: Associates a user settings resource with a web portal.

CreateBrowserSettings.name: CreateBrowserSettings
CreateBrowserSettings.documentation: Creates a browser settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, browser settings control how the browser will behave once a user starts a streaming session for the web portal.

CreateDataProtectionSettings.name: CreateDataProtectionSettings
CreateDataProtectionSettings.documentation: Creates a data protection settings resource that can be associated with a web portal.

CreateIdentityProvider.name: CreateIdentityProvider
CreateIdentityProvider.documentation: Creates an identity provider resource that is then associated with a web portal.

CreateIpAccessSettings.name: CreateIpAccessSettings
CreateIpAccessSettings.documentation: Creates an IP access settings resource that can be associated with a web portal.

CreateNetworkSettings.name: CreateNetworkSettings
CreateNetworkSettings.documentation: Creates a network settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, network settings define how streaming instances will connect with your specified VPC.

CreateTrustStore.name: CreateTrustStore
CreateTrustStore.documentation: Creates a trust store that can be associated with a web portal. A trust store contains certificate authority (CA) certificates. Once associated with a web portal, the browser in a streaming session will recognize certificates that have been issued using any of the CAs in the trust store. If your organization has internal websites that use certificates issued by private CAs, you should add the private CA certificate to the trust store.

CreateUserAccessLoggingSettings.name: CreateUserAccessLoggingSettings
CreateUserAccessLoggingSettings.documentation: Creates a user access logging settings resource that can be associated with a web portal.

CreateUserSettings.name: CreateUserSettings
CreateUserSettings.documentation: Creates a user settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, user settings control how users can transfer data between a streaming session and the their local devices.

DisassociateBrowserSettings.name: DisassociateBrowserSettings
DisassociateBrowserSettings.documentation: Disassociates browser settings from a web portal.

DisassociateDataProtectionSettings.name: DisassociateDataProtectionSettings
DisassociateDataProtectionSettings.documentation: Disassociates data protection settings from a web portal.

DisassociateIpAccessSettings.name: DisassociateIpAccessSettings
DisassociateIpAccessSettings.documentation: Disassociates IP access settings from a web portal.

DisassociateNetworkSettings.name: DisassociateNetworkSettings
DisassociateNetworkSettings.documentation: Disassociates network settings from a web portal.

DisassociateSessionLogger.name: DisassociateSessionLogger
DisassociateSessionLogger.documentation: Disassociates a session logger from a portal.

DisassociateTrustStore.name: DisassociateTrustStore
DisassociateTrustStore.documentation: Disassociates a trust store from a web portal.

DisassociateUserAccessLoggingSettings.name: DisassociateUserAccessLoggingSettings
DisassociateUserAccessLoggingSettings.documentation: Disassociates user access logging settings from a web portal.

DisassociateUserSettings.name: DisassociateUserSettings
DisassociateUserSettings.documentation: Disassociates user settings from a web portal.

GetSession.name: GetSession
GetSession.documentation: Gets information for a secure browser session.

GetSessionLogger.name: GetSessionLogger
GetSessionLogger.documentation: Gets details about a specific session logger resource.

ListDataProtectionSettings.name: ListDataProtectionSettings
ListDataProtectionSettings.documentation: Retrieves a list of data protection settings.

ListIdentityProviders.name: ListIdentityProviders
ListIdentityProviders.documentation: Retrieves a list of identity providers for a specific web portal.

ListIpAccessSettings.name: ListIpAccessSettings
ListIpAccessSettings.documentation: Retrieves a list of IP access settings.

ListSessions.name: ListSessions
ListSessions.documentation: Lists information for multiple secure browser sessions from a specific portal.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Retrieves a list of tags for a resource.

ListTrustStoreCertificates.name: ListTrustStoreCertificates
ListTrustStoreCertificates.documentation: Retrieves a list of trust store certificates.

ListUserAccessLoggingSettings.name: ListUserAccessLoggingSettings
ListUserAccessLoggingSettings.documentation: Retrieves a list of user access logging settings.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes one or more tags from the specified resource.

UpdateSessionLogger.name: UpdateSessionLogger
UpdateSessionLogger.documentation: Updates the details of a session logger.

dataProtectionSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the data protection settings.
The ARN of the data protection settings resource.

The ARN of the IP access settings resource.

portalArn.documentation: The ARN of the portal to associate to the session logger ARN.

sessionLoggerArn.documentation: The ARN of the session logger to associate to the portal ARN.

The ARN of the user access logging settings.

associatedPortalArns.documentation: A list of web portal ARNs that this browser settings is associated with.

browserPolicy.documentation: A JSON string containing Chrome Enterprise policies that will be applied to all streaming sessions.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The customer managed key used to encrypt sensitive information in the browser settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the browser settings.

BrowserSettings.documentation: The browser settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, browser settings control how the browser will behave once a user starts a streaming session for the web portal.

notValidBefore.documentation: The certificate is not valid before this date.

notValidAfter.documentation: The certificate is not valid after this date.

notValidBefore.documentation: The certificate is not valid before this date.

notValidAfter.documentation: The certificate is not valid after this date.

CookieSpecification.documentation: Specifies a single cookie or set of cookies in an end user's browser.

allowlist.documentation: The list of cookie specifications that are allowed to be synchronized to the remote browser.

blocklist.documentation: The list of cookie specifications that are blocked from being synchronized to the remote browser.

CookieSynchronizationConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that specifies which cookies should be synchronized from the end user's local browser to the remote browser.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the browser settings resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The custom managed key of the browser settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: Additional encryption context of the browser settings.

browserPolicy.documentation: A JSON string containing Chrome Enterprise policies that will be applied to all streaming sessions.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

displayName.documentation: The display name of the data protection settings.

description.documentation: The description of the data protection settings.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the data protection settings resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The custom managed key of the data protection settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: Additional encryption context of the data protection settings.

inlineRedactionConfiguration.documentation: The inline redaction configuration of the data protection settings that will be applied to all sessions.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

dataProtectionSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the data protection settings resource.

identityProviderDetails.documentation:
The identity provider details. The following list describes the provider detail keys for each identity provider type.

  • For Google and Login with Amazon:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

  • For Facebook:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

    • api_version

  • For Sign in with Apple:

    • client_id

    • team_id

    • key_id

    • private_key

    • authorize_scopes

  • For OIDC providers:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • attributes_request_method

    • oidc_issuer

    • authorize_scopes

    • authorize_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • token_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • attributes_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • jwks_uri if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

  • For SAML providers:

    • MetadataFile OR MetadataURL

    • IDPSignout (boolean) optional

    • IDPInit (boolean) optional

    • RequestSigningAlgorithm (string) optional - Only accepts rsa-sha256

    • EncryptedResponses (boolean) optional

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

ipAccessSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the IP access settings resource.

vpcId.documentation: The VPC that streaming instances will connect to.

subnetIds.documentation: The subnets in which network interfaces are created to connect streaming instances to your VPC. At least two of these subnets must be in different availability zones.

securityGroupIds.documentation: One or more security groups used to control access from streaming instances to your VPC.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the network settings resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

displayName.documentation: The name of the web portal. This is not visible to users who log into the web portal.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the web portal. A tag is a key-value pair.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The customer managed key of the web portal.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the portal.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

authenticationType.documentation:
The type of authentication integration points used when signing into the web portal. Defaults to Standard.

Standard web portals are authenticated directly through your identity provider. You need to call CreateIdentityProvider to integrate your identity provider with your web portal. User and group access to your web portal is controlled through your identity provider.

IAM Identity Center web portals are authenticated through IAM Identity Center. Identity sources (including external identity provider integration), plus user and group access to your web portal, can be configured in the IAM Identity Center.

instanceType.documentation: The type and resources of the underlying instance.

maxConcurrentSessions.documentation: The maximum number of concurrent sessions for the portal.

portalEndpoint.documentation: The endpoint URL of the web portal that users access in order to start streaming sessions.

eventFilter.documentation: The filter that specifies the events to monitor.

logConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that specifies where logs are delivered.

displayName.documentation: The human-readable display name for the session logger resource.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The custom managed key of the session logger.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the session logger.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the session logger.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request. If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the AWS SDK.

certificateList.documentation: A list of CA certificates to be added to the trust store.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the trust store. A tag is a key-value pair.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

userAccessLoggingSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the user access logging settings.

copyAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can copy text from the streaming session to the local device.

pasteAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can paste text from the local device to the streaming session.

downloadAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can download files from the streaming session to the local device.

uploadAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can upload files from the local device to the streaming session.

printAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can print to the local device.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the user settings resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

disconnectTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect.

idleDisconnectTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the disconnect timeout interval begins.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

cookieSynchronizationConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that specifies which cookies should be synchronized from the end user's local browser to the remote browser.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The customer managed key used to encrypt sensitive information in the user settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the user settings.

deepLinkAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can use deep links that open automatically when connecting to a session.

toolbarConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the toolbar. This allows administrators to select the toolbar type and visual mode, set maximum display resolution for sessions, and choose which items are visible to end users during their sessions. If administrators do not modify these settings, end users retain control over their toolbar preferences.

patternName.documentation: The pattern name for the custom pattern.

patternRegex.documentation: The pattern regex for the customer pattern. The format must follow JavaScript regex format. The pattern must be enclosed between slashes, and can have flags behind the second slash. For example: /ab+c/gi.

patternDescription.documentation: The pattern description for the customer pattern.

keywordRegex.documentation: The keyword regex for the customer pattern. After there is a match to the pattern regex, the keyword regex is used to search within the proximity of the match. If there is a keyword match, then the match is confirmed. If no keyword regex is provided, the pattern regex match will automatically be confirmed. The format must follow JavaScript regex format. The pattern must be enclosed between slashes, and can have flags behind the second slash. For example, /ab+c/gi

CustomPattern.documentation: The pattern configuration for redacting custom data types in session.

dataProtectionSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the data protection settings resource.

inlineRedactionConfiguration.documentation: The inline redaction configuration for the data protection settings.

associatedPortalArns.documentation: A list of web portal ARNs that this data protection settings resource is associated with.

displayName.documentation: The display name of the data protection settings.

description.documentation: The description of the data protection settings.

creationDate.documentation: The creation date timestamp of the data protection settings.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The customer managed key used to encrypt sensitive information in the data protection settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the data protection settings.

all.documentation: The filter that monitors all of the available events, including any new events emitted in the future.

include.documentation: The filter that monitors only the listed set of events. New events are not auto-monitored.

EventFilter.documentation: The filter that specifies the events to monitor.

sessionId.documentation: The ID of the session to expire.

identityProviderDetails.documentation:
The identity provider details. The following list describes the provider detail keys for each identity provider type.

  • For Google and Login with Amazon:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

  • For Facebook:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

    • api_version

  • For Sign in with Apple:

    • client_id

    • team_id

    • key_id

    • private_key

    • authorize_scopes

  • For OIDC providers:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • attributes_request_method

    • oidc_issuer

    • authorize_scopes

    • authorize_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • token_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • attributes_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • jwks_uri if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

  • For SAML providers:

    • MetadataFile OR MetadataURL

    • IDPSignout (boolean) optional

    • IDPInit (boolean) optional

    • RequestSigningAlgorithm (string) optional - Only accepts rsa-sha256

    • EncryptedResponses (boolean) optional

inlineRedactionPatterns.documentation: The inline redaction patterns to be enabled for the inline redaction configuration.

globalEnforcedUrls.documentation: The global enforced URL configuration for the inline redaction configuration. This is applied to patterns that do not have a pattern-level enforced URL list.

globalExemptUrls.documentation: The global exempt URL configuration for the inline redaction configuration. This is applied to patterns that do not have a pattern-level exempt URL list.

globalConfidenceLevel.documentation: The global confidence level for the inline redaction configuration. This indicates the certainty of data type matches in the redaction process. Confidence level 3 means high confidence, and requires a formatted text pattern match in order for content to be redacted. Confidence level 2 means medium confidence, and redaction considers both formatted and unformatted text, and adds keyword associate to the logic. Confidence level 1 means low confidence, and redaction is enforced for both formatted pattern + unformatted pattern without keyword. This is applied to patterns that do not have a pattern-level confidence level. Defaults to confidence level 2.

builtInPatternId.documentation: The built-in pattern from the list of preconfigured patterns. Either a customPattern or builtInPatternId is required.

customPattern.documentation: >The configuration for a custom pattern. Either a customPattern or builtInPatternId is required.

redactionPlaceHolder.documentation: The redaction placeholder that will replace the redacted text in session for the inline redaction pattern.

enforcedUrls.documentation: The enforced URL configuration for the inline redaction pattern. This will override the global enforced URL configuration.

exemptUrls.documentation: The exempt URL configuration for the inline redaction pattern. This will override the global exempt URL configuration for the inline redaction pattern.

confidenceLevel.documentation: The confidence level for inline redaction pattern. This indicates the certainty of data type matches in the redaction process. Confidence level 3 means high confidence, and requires a formatted text pattern match in order for content to be redacted. Confidence level 2 means medium confidence, and redaction considers both formatted and unformatted text, and adds keyword associate to the logic. Confidence level 1 means low confidence, and redaction is enforced for both formatted pattern + unformatted pattern without keyword. This overrides the global confidence level.

InlineRedactionPattern.documentation: The set of patterns that determine the data types redacted in session.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: Advice to clients on when the call can be safely retried.

s3.documentation: The configuration for delivering the logs to S3.

vpcId.documentation: The VPC that streaming instances will connect to.

subnetIds.documentation: The subnets in which network interfaces are created to connect streaming instances to your VPC. At least two of these subnets must be in different availability zones.

securityGroupIds.documentation: One or more security groups used to control access from streaming instances to your VPC.

NetworkSettings.documentation: A network settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, network settings define how streaming instances will connect with your specified VPC.

authenticationType.documentation:
The type of authentication integration points used when signing into the web portal. Defaults to Standard.

Standard web portals are authenticated directly through your identity provider. You need to call CreateIdentityProvider to integrate your identity provider with your web portal. User and group access to your web portal is controlled through your identity provider.

IAM Identity Center web portals are authenticated through IAM Identity Center. Identity sources (including external identity provider integration), plus user and group access to your web portal, can be configured in the IAM Identity Center.

sessionLoggerArn.documentation: The ARN of the session logger that is assocaited with the portal.

trustStoreArn.documentation: The ARN of the trust that is associated with this web portal.

userAccessLoggingSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the user access logging settings that is associated with the web portal.

authenticationType.documentation:
The type of authentication integration points used when signing into the web portal. Defaults to Standard.

Standard web portals are authenticated directly through your identity provider. You need to call CreateIdentityProvider to integrate your identity provider with your web portal. User and group access to your web portal is controlled through your identity provider.

IAM Identity Center web portals are authenticated through IAM Identity Center. Identity sources (including external identity provider integration), plus user and group access to your web portal, can be configured in the IAM Identity Center.

ipAccessSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the IP access settings.

instanceType.documentation: The type and resources of the underlying instance.

maxConcurrentSessions.documentation: The maximum number of concurrent sessions for the portal.

redactionPlaceHolderType.documentation: The redaction placeholder type that will replace the redacted text in session.

redactionPlaceHolderText.documentation: The redaction placeholder text that will replace the redacted text in session for the custom text redaction placeholder type.

RedactionPlaceHolder.documentation: The redaction placeholder that will replace the redacted text in session.

bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket name where logs are delivered.

keyPrefix.documentation: The S3 path prefix that determines where log files are stored.

bucketOwner.documentation: The expected bucket owner of the target S3 bucket. The caller must have permissions to write to the target bucket.

logFileFormat.documentation: The format of the LogFile that is written to S3.

folderStructure.documentation: The folder structure that defines the organizational structure for log files in S3.

sessionLoggerArn.documentation: The ARN of the session logger resource.

eventFilter.documentation: The filter that specifies which events to monitor.

logConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that specifies where logs are fowarded.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The custom managed key of the session logger.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the session logger.

creationDate.documentation: The date the session logger resource was created.

sessionLoggerArn.documentation: The ARN of the session logger resource.

logConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that specifies where the logs are fowarded.

creationDate.documentation: The date the session logger resource was created.

SessionLoggerSummary.documentation: The summary of the session logger resource.

SessionSummary.documentation: Summary information about a secure browser session.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: Advice to clients on when the call can be safely retried.

toolbarType.documentation: The type of toolbar displayed during the session.

hiddenToolbarItems.documentation: The list of toolbar items to be hidden.

maxDisplayResolution.documentation: The maximum display resolution that is allowed for the session.

ToolbarConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the toolbar. This allows administrators to select the toolbar type and visual mode, set maximum display resolution for sessions, and choose which items are visible to end users during their sessions. If administrators do not modify these settings, end users retain control over their toolbar preferences.

associatedPortalArns.documentation: A list of web portal ARNs that this trust store is associated with.

TrustStore.documentation: A trust store that can be associated with a web portal. A trust store contains certificate authority (CA) certificates. Once associated with a web portal, the browser in a streaming session will recognize certificates that have been issued using any of the CAs in the trust store. If your organization has internal websites that use certificates issued by private CAs, you should add the private CA certificate to the trust store.

tagKeys.documentation: The list of tag keys to remove from the resource.

browserPolicy.documentation: A JSON string containing Chrome Enterprise policies that will be applied to all streaming sessions.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

dataProtectionSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the data protection settings.

inlineRedactionConfiguration.documentation: The inline redaction configuration of the data protection settings that will be applied to all sessions.

displayName.documentation: The display name of the data protection settings.

description.documentation: The description of the data protection settings.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

identityProviderDetails.documentation:
The details of the identity provider. The following list describes the provider detail keys for each identity provider type.

  • For Google and Login with Amazon:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

  • For Facebook:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • authorize_scopes

    • api_version

  • For Sign in with Apple:

    • client_id

    • team_id

    • key_id

    • private_key

    • authorize_scopes

  • For OIDC providers:

    • client_id

    • client_secret

    • attributes_request_method

    • oidc_issuer

    • authorize_scopes

    • authorize_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • token_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • attributes_url if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

    • jwks_uri if not available from discovery URL specified by oidc_issuer key

  • For SAML providers:

    • MetadataFile OR MetadataURL

    • IDPSignout (boolean) optional

    • IDPInit (boolean) optional

    • RequestSigningAlgorithm (string) optional - Only accepts rsa-sha256

    • EncryptedResponses (boolean) optional

description.documentation: The description of the IP access settings.

ipRules.documentation: The updated IP rules of the IP access settings.

vpcId.documentation: The VPC that streaming instances will connect to.

subnetIds.documentation: The subnets in which network interfaces are created to connect streaming instances to your VPC. At least two of these subnets must be in different availability zones.

securityGroupIds.documentation: One or more security groups used to control access from streaming instances to your VPC.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

displayName.documentation: The name of the web portal. This is not visible to users who log into the web portal.

authenticationType.documentation:
The type of authentication integration points used when signing into the web portal. Defaults to Standard.

Standard web portals are authenticated directly through your identity provider. You need to call CreateIdentityProvider to integrate your identity provider with your web portal. User and group access to your web portal is controlled through your identity provider.

IAM Identity Center web portals are authenticated through IAM Identity Center. Identity sources (including external identity provider integration), plus user and group access to your web portal, can be configured in the IAM Identity Center.

maxConcurrentSessions.documentation: The maximum number of concurrent sessions for the portal.

sessionLoggerArn.documentation: The ARN of the session logger to update.

sessionLogger.documentation: The updated details of the session logger.

certificatesToAdd.documentation: A list of CA certificates to add to the trust store.

certificatesToDelete.documentation: A list of CA certificates to delete from a trust store.

With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

copyAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can copy text from the streaming session to the local device.

pasteAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can paste text from the local device to the streaming session.

downloadAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can download files from the streaming session to the local device.

uploadAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can upload files from the local device to the streaming session.

printAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can print to the local device.

disconnectTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect.

idleDisconnectTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the disconnect timeout interval begins.

clientToken.documentation:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the Amazon Web Services SDK.

cookieSynchronizationConfiguration.documentation:
The configuration that specifies which cookies should be synchronized from the end user's local browser to the remote browser.

If the allowlist and blocklist are empty, the configuration becomes null.

deepLinkAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can use deep links that open automatically when connecting to a session.

toolbarConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the toolbar. This allows administrators to select the toolbar type and visual mode, set maximum display resolution for sessions, and choose which items are visible to end users during their sessions. If administrators do not modify these settings, end users retain control over their toolbar preferences.

userAccessLoggingSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the user access logging settings.

associatedPortalArns.documentation: A list of web portal ARNs that this user access logging settings is associated with.

UserAccessLoggingSettings.documentation: A user access logging settings resource that can be associated with a web portal.

userAccessLoggingSettingsArn.documentation: The ARN of the user access logging settings.

UserAccessLoggingSettingsSummary.documentation: The summary of user access logging settings.

associatedPortalArns.documentation: A list of web portal ARNs that this user settings is associated with.

idleDisconnectTimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the disconnect timeout interval begins.

customerManagedKey.documentation: The customer managed key used to encrypt sensitive information in the user settings.

additionalEncryptionContext.documentation: The additional encryption context of the user settings.

deepLinkAllowed.documentation: Specifies whether the user can use deep links that open automatically when connecting to a session.

If administrators do not modify these settings, end users retain control over their toolbar preferences.

UserSettings.documentation: A user settings resource that can be associated with a web portal. Once associated with a web portal, user settings control how users can transfer data between a streaming session and the their local devices.

This allows administrators to select the toolbar type and visual mode, set maximum display resolution for sessions, and choose which items are visible to end users during their sessions. name.documentation: The name of the field that failed validation.

message.documentation: The message describing why the field failed validation.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: Information about a field passed inside a request that resulted in an exception.

documentation: Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser is a low cost, fully managed WorkSpace built specifically to facilitate secure, web-based workloads. WorkSpaces Secure Browser makes it easy for customers to safely provide their employees with access to internal websites and SaaS web applications without the administrative burden of appliances or specialized client software. WorkSpaces Secure Browser provides simple policy tools tailored for user interactions, while offloading common tasks like capacity management, scaling, and maintaining browser images.
